intro: Chassalia assimilis, commonly known as the slender chassalia, is a flowering plant native to the African continent. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its slender stems and narrow leaves are adapted to arid environments, and it produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and white. Chassalia assimilis is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
